comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: A high resolution (24MB TIFF) file is available through the persistent URL in the description, but the speckly effect in this case seems to come from a rougher than usual registration in the original photomechanical print. Here's the link to the description of this special printing process, invented in Switzerland in the 1880s. We included a close-up view to make the 'printing dots' easier to see, lcweb2.loc.gov/pp/pgzhtml/pgzproc.html

comment._content:
Glaciers are shrinking; icebergs are melting and disappearing. Their are fewer seals because there are fewer fish and the polar Bears are dying because their food supply (seal) has dwindled . This is what these pictures say to me.

Perhaps I should invite you to ome of my other groups called DRAMA.
